newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: NZSE details changes, proposed changes to indices.
newsitem.headline: NZSE details changes, proposed changes to indices.

text.p: The New Zealand Stock Exchange on Friday said that following its March Quarterly Index Review, the following changes would be made, effective April 1.
Nuplex Industries Ltd will be added to the NZSE-40 Index, and Affco Holdings Ltd will be removed.
The Exchange said the weighting of the current overseas index constituents would be changed as follows:
The Exchange also said it had recently received comments on the NZSE-40 and NZSE-30 Indices and their representation of the market.
"The Exchange proposes that the NZSE-30 Index should be a representation of those securities that are more freely available for investment in proportion to their index weighting," the Exchange said.
"This would be distinct from the NZSE-40 Index which would remain as an index representing the general market."
The Exchange said it proposed that one of the following two changes be made for the NZSE-30 Index.
1. Implementing a liquidity criteria similar to the NZSE-10 Index in unison with the float capital concept.
2. Implementing a liquidity criteria similar to the NZSE-10 Index and discontinuing the float capital concept.
"The Exchange welcomes comments from interested parties on these proposals and the manner of implementation of such changes," the Exchange said.
